botanical_details.genus: Begonia can be annuals, evergreen or deciduous perennials or shrubs, with fibrous, tuberous or rhizomatous roots and usually asymmetrical leaves, often strikingly patterned, and small or large flowers, both male and female in the same cluster

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in light, well-drained, neutral to slightly acid potting compost, in full light with shade from hot sun. Water moderately when in growth, ideally by immersing pots and allowing to drain, as this helps to prevent waterlogging. See begonias: houseplants for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by leaf cuttings, or by root cuttings using sections of rhizome
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove faded flower stems after flowering
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to caterpillars, mealybugs, mites, thrips, vine weevils and aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey moulds, powdery mildews, stem rot and rhizome rot
